texto: maintained and protected. 9.3.2 When defining how to determine, maintain and protect knowledge, the organization should develop processes to address: a) lessons learned from failures and successful projects; b) explicit and tacit knowledge that exists within the organization, including the knowledge, insights and experience of its people; c) determining the need to acquire knowledge from interested parties as part of the organization’s strategy (see 9.6); d) confirming the effective distribution and understanding of information, throughout the life cycle(s) of the organization’s products and services; e) managing documented information and its use; f) managing intellectual property. 9.4
